body_html: Just my two cents: tf.distributions is pretty nice. Being able to not only sample from a parameterised distribution, but also having access to functions such as mean, cdf, covariance, prob, log_prob etc. is handy. So exposing these publicly as well as using log_prob for reinforce seems like it could be useful.

body: Just my two cents: [`tf.distributions`](https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/distributions) is pretty nice. Being able to not only `sample` from a parameterised distribution, but also having access to functions such as `mean`, `cdf`, `covariance`, `prob`, `log_prob` etc. is handy. So exposing these publicly as well as using `log_prob` for `reinforce` seems like it could be useful.
